intro: Erdisia apiciflora, commonly known as the apiciflora erdisia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. Erdisia apiciflora is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
